As the Russia-Ukraine war entered Day 23, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Thursday held a telephonic conversation with French counterpart Emmanuel Macron, stressing the importance of France's support for Kyiv. Taking to Twitter, Zelenskyy informed, during the brief call, he also emphasised the continuation of peace dialogue aimed at ending the conflict by strengthening the "anti-war coalition."

Continued dialogue with üá´üá∑ President @EmmanuelMacron. Discussed the support for Ukrainians in the fight against Russian aggression, especially in the defense sphere. Emphasis was put on the continuation of peaceful dialogue. We must strengthen the anti-war coalition. #StopRussia ‚Äî –í–æ–ª–æ–¥–∏–º–∏—Ä –ó–µ–ª–µ–Ω—Å—å–∫–∏–π (@ZelenskyyUa) March 17, 2022

The discussion comes as Paris has maintained a firm policy of dialogue and solidarity with Ukraine. Macron has also vouched for a political settlement of the all-out conflict and joined its Western and European allies to pressure Russia to de-escalate tensions. Earlier this week, Macron pledged to continue speaking to Russian President Vladimir Putin, despite the lack of fruitful outcome. "I won't tell you that I am satisfied, but we need to continue," the French President said while speaking on France's TF1 channel.

Notably, Macron has spoken to Putin multiple times in the last month, the latest being on Saturday. The call included German Chancellor Olaf Scholz. "Europe can't be safe and at peace, if it doesn't talk to Russia," Macron has said, explaining his flurry of phone calls. He further added that the objective of the dialogues is to "try to break his (Putin's) logic" and keep the line of communication open over manifold issues, including humanitarian corridors, protection of nuclear plants, and potential cessation of the war.

Russia-Ukraine war

The developments come as the Russian attack on Ukraine intensified with each passing day since it began on February 24. The war ensued months of undeterred military build-up along the Donbass region, which Putin unilaterally identified as independent, effectively annulling the Minsk Accord. The all-out war has killed thousands, further damaging infrastructure worth billions.

Nothing the escalating devastation in Ukraine, Ukrainian Foreign Ministry spokesperson Oleg Nikolenko on Thursday demanded Moscow must give up its rights granted under the UN Charter, under which Russia currently holds power to veto. His statement came after Moscow defied the order of the International Court of Justice (ICJ), which asked Russia to cease military operations in Ukraine.

(Image: AP)

US President Joe Biden has called Putin a ‚Äúmurderous dictator, a pure thug who is waging an immoral war against the people of Ukraine‚Äù.

In a televised address at the Annual Friends of Ireland Luncheon in Washington, Mr Biden said Putin is paying a ‚Äúbig price for his aggression‚Äù.

Until Wednesday, the Biden administration had avoided calling Putin a war criminal to preserve the chance of negotiating an end to the war with Moscow.

But in an off-the-cuff remark on Wednesday night, the US president responded to a reporter's question by saying: "I think he is a war criminal."

Mr Biden will hold a call on Friday with Chinese leader Xi Jinping as Washington piles pressure on China to not support Russia's invasion of Ukraine, a step that would dramatically widen the gulf between Beijing and Western governments.

‚Äã‚ÄãFollow the latest updates in Friday's live blog.

"It's also very important for the French that their country still has an important role at a world level. So when they see Macron talking to Putin, even at a very long table, it reassures them. The French are very sensitive to the question of whether they still count in the world - and Macron makes them feel they do."

Russia: Putin 'may use chemical weapons' says expert

Vladimir Putin gave the go-ahead for more than 1,000 Russian troops lining the Ukraine border to begin invading the country nearly a month ago on February 24. Since then, missiles have rained down on several Ukrainian cities with violent explosions occurring throughout the stricken country. Western countries have moved to slam Russia with financial sanctions aimed at crippling the Russian economy and bringing down Putin.

The UK, acting alone outside the EU following Brexit, last week imposed asset freezes and travel bans on seven leading oligarchs and 386 members of the Russian Duma - and has since announced a ban on exports to Russia of high-end luxury goods. Brussels hit Russia hard this week with a fourth package of restrictive measures, including bans on Russian energy sector investments, luxury goods exports to Moscow and imports of steel products from Russia. The sanctions also saw a freeze on assets of Russian oligarchs. But the EU had been widely criticised for not doing enough early on, including member states not agreeing to ban Russia from the global SWIFT banking system, as well as hesitation over what to do about the Nord Stream 2 gas line project.

Emmanuel Macron news: The French President's response to Russian aggression has been savaged

Emmanuel Macron news: Vladimir Putin gave the go-ahead for Russia to invade Ukraine

Mr Macron has also held several phone calls and meetings in Moscow with Putin but they have seemingly made no difference, with Russia ramping up its aggression against Ukraine. Nile Gardiner, a foreign policy expert and former aide to Margaret Thatcher, launched a furious attack, telling Express.co.uk: "Take Emmanuel Macron for example - what has he done to ever stand up to Putin? "Macron sees himself as some kind of statesman and peacemaker but the reality is Macron is just seen as a useful idiot by Putin. "Putin is seeking concessions from Macron and the Europeans. He believes Macron is just a soft touch." READ MORE: Russian soldiers now begging Ukrainians for food as villagers hounded

Emmanuel Macron news: The French President held a meeting with Putin in Moscow several metres apart

Mr Gardiner also didn't hold back against the actions of the EU towards Russia, warning the bloc's "limited response" shows it is "incapable of standing up to the likes of Putin". He raged: "The EU as a whole has been absolutely pathetic and useless in confronting Russia. "They have appeased Putin for decades upon decades. Now they are starting to wake up but even now, their response is limited. "I suspect most EU leaders just want the whole Ukraine crisis to just go away and for things to get back to normal. The EU is incapable of standing up to the likes of Putin." DON'T MISS

On Thursday, Mr Macron claimed Russia's invasion of Ukraine had delivered an "electric shock" to the defence alliance and given it a new strategic clarity that it was lacking. The French President was on his campaign for re-election when asked whether he previously regretted describing NATO as "brain dead". Mr Macron replied: "Russia has given us a wake-up call. "I always considered that we needed a strategic clarification, and we are in the process of getting it."

Emmanuel Macron news: NATO forces line up against Russia

Trending

This Thursday, Russian forces are still positioned around the capital kyiv and the port of Mariupol, where thousands of Ukrainians find themselves besieged. Follow the latest information live.

9:05 p.m.

Ukrainian President Zelensky said on Twitter that he spoke with Emmanuel Macron. The two presidents notably discussed French support for Ukraine, particularly in terms of defence.

Continued dialogue with President @EmmanuelMacron. Discussed the support for Ukrainians in the fight against Russian aggression, especially in the defense sphere. Emphasis was put on the continuation of peaceful dialogue. We must strengthen the anti-war coalition. #StopRussia ‚Äî –í–æ–ª–æ–¥–∏–º–∏—Ä –ó–µ–ª–µ–Ω—Å—å–∫–∏–π (@ZelenskyyUa) March 17, 2022

7:49 p.m.

US has been skeptical of ongoing talks between Ukraine and Russia to end the war, saying Moscow has so far failed to demonstrate ‚Äòsignificant effort‚Äô on the diplomatic front .

7:24 p.m.

The head of the American diplomacy Antony Blinken considered that the Russian attacks against civilians in Ukraine constituted ‚Äúwar crimes‚Äù. ‚ÄúIntentionally targeting civilians is a war crime. After so much destruction in the past three weeks, I find it difficult to conclude that the Russians are doing anything other than that,‚Äù he told a press conference, while stating that the legal process to arrive at such a formal charge was still ongoing.

7:08 p.m.

France will release aid of 300 million euros for Ukraine, which has been facing an attack from Russia since February 24, announced the French Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

6:08 p.m.

Several Russian shots killed at least 27 people in the besieged Kharkiv region, a large city in northeastern Ukraine, local authorities said.

5:20 p.m.

The authorities of the Ukrainian city of Mariupol, besieged by Russian forces, announced the evacuation of 30,000 people in one week, adding that they did not yet know the toll of the bombardment the day before of a theater where civilians were sheltering.

According to a message from the town hall on Telegram, the situation is ‚Äúcritical‚Äù with ‚Äúuninterrupted‚Äù Russian bombardments and ‚Äúcolossal‚Äù destruction. ‚ÄúAccording to initial estimates, around 80% of the city‚Äôs housing stock has been destroyed,‚Äù she added.

5:10 p.m.

JPMorgan did receive a payment from the Russian Central Bank intended to pay a tranche of interest linked to bonds and then, with the agreement of the American authorities, transmitted it to Citigroup now in charge of distributing the money to the holders. bonds, said a source familiar with the matter.

5:06 p.m.

The perpetrators of war crimes perpetrated in Ukraine, where the Russian army is accused of bombing civilian populations, will be ‚Äúaccountable‚Äù before international justice, warned the G7 foreign ministers in a joint statement.

3:57 p.m.

The leader of the Russian republic of Chechnya, Ramzan Kadyrov, assured Thursday that a ‚Äúthousand‚Äù Chechen volunteers are on their way to fight in Ukraine, three weeks after the start of the Moscow offensive.

3:22 p.m.

Russian artillery fire left at least 21 dead and 25 injured in the town of Merefa, near the besieged city of Kharkiv in eastern Ukraine, the regional prosecutor‚Äôs office said.

‚ÄúRussian soldiers fired artillery at the town of Merefa in the Kharkiv region around 3:30 a.m. (0130 GMT) on Thursday. A school and a cultural center were destroyed. 21 people were killed and 25 injured, including 10 are in serious condition,‚Äù the prosecutor‚Äôs office of the Kharkiv region announced on its Facebook account.

1:20 p.m.

Ukraine is trying to find out on Thursday whether the bombardment of a theater where several hundred civilians would have taken refuge in the besieged city of Mariupol had caused victims, exactly three weeks after the start of the Russian invasion. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has launched a new appeal for help to Westerners, this time before the German Parliament. ‚ÄúIn Mariupol, the Russian Air Force knowingly dropped a bomb on the Drama Theater in the city center. The building is destroyed,‚Äù Zelensky said on Wednesday. ‚ÄúThe number of dead is not yet known.‚Äù

‚ÄúThe world must finally admit that Russia has become a terrorist state,‚Äù he said. The town hall of this strategic port on the Sea of ‚Äã‚ÄãAzov said overnight from Wednesday to Thursday that ‚Äúmore than a thousand‚Äù people were in the theater. A deputy, Sergui Tarouta, told him on Facebook, without citing his sources, that people came out alive from the rubble, the shelter under the theater having held. Ukrainian officials posted a photo appearing to show the three-story building in flames and devastated by an explosion. It is ‚Äúa terrible tragedy,‚Äù said Mayor Vadim Boitchenko, accusing Moscow of carrying out a ‚Äúgenocide‚Äù of the Ukrainian people.

12:50 p.m.

‚ÄúWe are facing a significant increase in the number of Ukrainian refugees arriving in Paris,‚Äù said the first deputy mayor of Paris Emmanuel Gr√©goire this Thursday, March 17, explaining that their number had increased from ‚Äú350 arrivals day‚Äù at the start. from the crisis to ‚Äúa thousand arrivals day today‚Äù.

While most of them arrive in Paris from Gare de l‚ÄôEst and Gare du Nord, some refugees also arrive by bus. Without being able to know their precise number.

The elected official underlined the ‚Äúdisorder in the information‚Äù which made it complicated ‚Äúto anticipate the arrivals‚Äù and therefore ‚Äúvery difficult‚Äù to know the exact number of Ukrainian refugees who had already arrived in Paris.

12:16 p.m.

More than 100,000 refugees have been added in 24 hours to the three million people who have already fled Ukraine and the fighting sparked by the invasion of the Russian army on February 24, according to the UN count published Thursday .

The UN has also identified around two million internally displaced people. Half of the refugees are children.

11:58

The war in Ukraine risks costing global growth a percentage point in a year if its effects on energy and financial markets prove to be long-lasting, the OECD warned in a report on Thursday, and could push inflation by around 2 .5 additional points.

‚ÄúThe role of Russia and Ukraine in the world economy is weak,‚Äù says the OECD, quantifying this weight at 2% of world GDP, as is the share of these two states in world trade. However, these two countries have a ‚Äúsignificant influence on the world economy‚Äù through their weight in many raw materials: they represent 30% of world wheat exports, 20% for corn, mineral fertilizers and natural gas, and 11% for oil, estimates the OECD.

10:07

Russia assured Thursday that it had paid a first installment of bond repayments, immediately removing the possibility of a default, while its assets abroad are frozen by Western sanctions.

‚ÄúThe payment order on the repayment of interest on bonds (‚Ä¶) with a total value of 117.2 million dollars (‚Ä¶) has been carried out,‚Äù the Russian Finance Ministry said in a statement. a statement.

9:51

The war in Ukraine will significantly hamper the German economic recovery and halve the expected GDP growth in 2022 to 2.1%, the economic institute IfW Kiel estimated on Thursday.

The consequences of the conflict should cut GDP by ‚Äúsome 90 billion euros this year and next year‚Äù and ‚Äúdelay the return to the pre-Covid level‚Äù of the first European economy until the second half of the year, judge the economists, who predicted growth of 4% this year so far.

9:47

Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky on Thursday urged Germany to tear down the new ‚Äúwall‚Äù erected in Europe against freedom since the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

‚ÄúDear Chancellor (Olaf) Scholz, tear down this wall, give Germany the leadership role it deserves,‚Äù the Ukrainian leader said in a video speech broadcast to the lower house of the German parliament.

5:50

US President Joe Biden on Wednesday called Russian President Vladimir Putin, who launched the invasion of Ukraine, a ‚Äúwar criminal‚Äù. The American president has confirmed the sending of 800 million dollars of additional military aid to Ukraine, an ‚Äúunprecedented‚Äù envelope of one billion dollars in one week.

‚ÄúWe are helping Ukraine to acquire additional and longer range air defense systems,‚Äù he said. A little earlier, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky had directly challenged Joe Biden to demand more aid and the establishment of a no-fly zone over his country.

3h45

Ukrainian authorities said Russia destroyed a theater in the besieged city of Mariupol on Wednesday, where more than 1,000 people are believed to have taken refuge, with the death toll still undetermined.

‚ÄúThe invaders destroyed the Dramatic Theater. A place where more than a thousand people had taken refuge. We will never forgive this, ‚Äùsaid the municipality on Telegram messaging.

Russians dropped powerful bombs on the buildings of Mariupol drama theater and indoor pool, which were used by women and kids as a shelter. Ukrainian Army continues counterattacking in Bucha, Irpin and other Kyiv suburbs. The Pentagon agreed in giving Ukraine 800 systems of anti-air defense and other military equipment. The United Kingdom will provide Ukraine with state-of-the-art portable anti-aircraft missile systems Starstreak.
